title: عواصم العالم - انجليزي
description: A quiz to test your knowledge of world capitals.

questions.text: What is the capital of Afghanistan?
questions.explanation: Kabul is the capital and largest city of Afghanistan, an economic and cultural center located in a narrow valley between the Hindu Kush mountains.

questions.text: What is the capital of Bahrain?
questions.explanation: Manama is the capital of the Kingdom of Bahrain, an important financial center known for the Manama Souq and Bab Al Bahrain.

questions.text: What is the capital of Bangladesh?
questions.explanation: Dhaka is the capital of Bangladesh and is known as the 'City of Mosques.' It is one of the most densely populated cities in the world.

questions.text: What is the capital of Bhutan?
questions.explanation: Thimphu is the capital of Bhutan and is unique for being the only capital city in the world without traffic lights.

questions.text: What is the capital of Brunei?
questions.explanation: Bandar Seri Begawan is the capital of the Sultanate of Brunei. It is famous for the Sultan Omar Ali Saifuddien Mosque with its golden dome.

questions.text: What is the capital of Cambodia?
questions.explanation: Phnom Penh is the capital of Cambodia and is located at the confluence of the Mekong, Tonlé Sap, and Bassac rivers.

questions.text: What is the capital of China?
questions.explanation: Beijing is the capital of China, with a rich history stretching back thousands of years and home to famous landmarks like the Forbidden City.

questions.text: What is the capital of East Timor?
questions.explanation: Dili is the capital and largest city of East Timor, serving as the country's main port and commercial center.

questions.text: What is the capital of India?
questions.explanation: New Delhi is the political capital of India, located within the greater Delhi metropolitan area.

questions.text: What is the capital of Indonesia?
questions.explanation: Jakarta, located on the island of Java, is the capital and largest city of Indonesia, and a vital hub for economy and culture.

questions.text: What is the capital of Iran?
questions.explanation: Tehran is the capital and largest city of Iran, located at the foot of the Alborz mountain range.

questions.text: What is the capital of Iraq?
questions.explanation: Baghdad is the capital of Iraq and one of the oldest cities in the Islamic world, once a center of learning and culture.

questions.text: What is the capital of Japan?
questions.explanation: Tokyo is the capital of Japan and is the world's largest metropolitan area by population.

questions.text: What is the capital of Jordan?
questions.explanation: Amman is the capital of the Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan, a city that combines ancient historical sites with modern development.

questions.text: What is the capital of Kazakhstan?
questions.explanation: Astana (formerly Nur-Sultan) has been the capital of Kazakhstan since 1997 and is known for its modern and futuristic architecture.

questions.text: What is the capital of Kuwait?
questions.explanation: Kuwait City is the political and economic capital of the State of Kuwait, famous for the Kuwait Towers which symbolize its modern renaissance.

questions.text: What is the capital of Kyrgyzstan?
questions.explanation: Bishkek is the capital and largest city of Kyrgyzstan, known for its wide avenues and Soviet-style architecture.

questions.text: What is the capital of Laos?
questions.explanation: Vientiane is the capital of Laos, situated on the banks of the Mekong River. It is famous for the gold-covered stupa, Pha That Luang.

questions.text: What is the capital of Lebanon?
questions.explanation: Beirut is the capital and the commercial and cultural center of Lebanon. It was nicknamed the 'Paris of the East' for its cultural vibrancy.

questions.text: What is the capital of Malaysia?
questions.explanation: Kuala Lumpur is the official capital of Malaysia, famous for its Petronas Twin Towers.

questions.text: What is the capital of the Maldives?
questions.explanation: Malé is the capital of the Maldives and one of the most densely populated cities in the world.

questions.text: What is the capital of Mongolia?
questions.explanation: Ulaanbaatar is the capital and largest city of Mongolia. Located in the valley of the Tuul River, it is the coldest national capital in the world.

questions.text: What is the capital of Myanmar?
questions.explanation: Naypyidaw has been the capital of Myanmar since 2005; it is a planned city built to be the country's new administrative center.

questions.text: What is the capital of Nepal?
questions.explanation: Kathmandu is the capital of Nepal, located in a valley surrounded by the Himalayan mountains. It is famous for its historic temples.

questions.text: What is the capital of North Korea?
questions.explanation: Pyongyang is the capital and largest city of North Korea. It is known for its huge monuments and socialist-style architecture.

questions.text: What is the capital of Oman?
questions.explanation: Muscat is the capital of the Sultanate of Oman, a coastal city that blends modernity with heritage.

questions.text: What is the capital of Pakistan?
questions.explanation: Islamabad is the federal capital of Pakistan, a planned city built in the 1960s known for its green spaces.

questions.text: What is the capital of Palestine?
questions.explanation: Jerusalem is the declared capital of the State of Palestine, and is a holy city for the three Abrahamic religions.

questions.text: What is the capital of the Philippines?
questions.explanation: Manila is the capital of the Philippines, a densely populated coastal city known for its history blending Spanish and American influences.

questions.text: What is the capital of Qatar?
questions.explanation: Doha is the capital of Qatar and its main economic center, and it hosted the 2022 FIFA World Cup.

questions.text: What is the capital of Saudi Arabia?
questions.explanation: Riyadh is the capital and largest city of Saudi Arabia, and it is a major financial and administrative hub in the Middle East.

questions.text: What is the capital of Singapore?
questions.explanation: Singapore is a city-state, so the capital is Singapore itself. It is famous for its cleanliness, order, and stunning gardens.

questions.text: What is the capital of South Korea?
questions.explanation: Seoul is the capital and the financial and cultural center of South Korea, a modern city that preserves its historic palaces.

questions.text: What is the capital of Sri Lanka?
questions.explanation: Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte is the legislative capital of Sri Lanka, while the nearby city of Colombo is the commercial and executive capital.

questions.text: What is the capital of Syria?
questions.explanation: Damascus is the capital of Syria and is considered one of the oldest continuously inhabited cities in the world.

questions.text: What is the capital of Taiwan?
questions.explanation: Taipei is the capital of Taiwan, famous for the Taipei 101 tower, which was once the tallest building in the world.

questions.text: What is the capital of Tajikistan?
questions.explanation: Dushanbe is the capital of Tajikistan. The word 'Dushanbe' means 'Monday' in the Persian language.

questions.text: What is the capital of Thailand?
questions.explanation: Bangkok is the capital of Thailand, known for its ornate temples, royal palaces, and vibrant street life.

questions.text: What is the capital of Turkey?
questions.explanation: Although Istanbul is the largest city, Ankara has been the official capital of Turkey since 1923.

questions.text: What is the capital of Turkmenistan?
questions.explanation: Ashgabat is the capital of Turkmenistan, known for its white marble buildings and holding a Guinness World Record for the highest density of marble buildings.

questions.text: What is the capital of the United Arab Emirates?
questions.explanation: Abu Dhabi is the capital of the UAE, known as an important economic center and home to the Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque.

questions.text: What is the capital of Uzbekistan?
questions.explanation: Tashkent is the capital and largest city of Uzbekistan, and an important economic and cultural hub in Central Asia.

questions.text: What is the capital of Vietnam?
questions.explanation: Hanoi is the capital of Vietnam, known for its centuries-old architecture with Southeast Asian, Chinese, and French influences.

questions.text: What is the capital of Yemen?
questions.explanation: Sana'a is the constitutional capital of Yemen, famous for its unique Old City, a UNESCO World Heritage site.

questions.text: What is the capital of Albania?
questions.explanation: Tirana is the capital of Albania and its economic and cultural center. It is known for its colorful buildings from the Ottoman, Italian, and Soviet eras.

questions.text: What is the capital of Andorra?
questions.explanation: Andorra la Vella is the capital of Andorra, and it is the highest capital city in Europe, located in the Pyrenees mountains.

questions.text: What is the capital of Austria?
questions.explanation: Vienna is the capital of Austria and its cultural center. It is famous for its rich musical history and magnificent imperial palaces.

questions.text: What is the capital of Belarus?
questions.explanation: Minsk is the capital of Belarus. It was heavily destroyed in World War II and rebuilt, featuring prominent Soviet-style architecture.

questions.text: What is the capital of Belgium?
questions.explanation: Brussels is the capital of Belgium and is also considered the de facto capital of the European Union due to it hosting the EU's main institutions.

questions.text: What is the capital of Bosnia and Herzegovina?
questions.explanation: Sarajevo is the capital of Bosnia and Herzegovina. It is known as a meeting point of Eastern and Western cultures and was the site of the event that sparked World War I.

questions.text: What is the capital of Bulgaria?
questions.explanation: Sofia is the capital of Bulgaria and one of the oldest cities in Europe, containing many Roman and Ottoman monuments.

questions.text: What is the capital of Croatia?
questions.explanation: Zagreb is the capital of Croatia. It is distinguished by its historic Austro-Hungarian Upper Town and its modern Lower Town.

questions.text: What is the capital of Cyprus?
questions.explanation: Nicosia is the capital of Cyprus and is the world's only divided capital, with a UN ceasefire line separating its two parts.

questions.text: What is the capital of the Czech Republic?
questions.explanation: Prague is the capital of the Czech Republic, nicknamed the 'City of a Hundred Spires.' It is famous for its Old Town Square, astronomical clock, and the historic Charles Bridge.

questions.text: What is the capital of Denmark?
questions.explanation: Copenhagen is the capital of Denmark, known for its Little Mermaid statue and Tivoli Gardens, one of the oldest amusement parks in the world.

questions.text: What is the capital of Estonia?
questions.explanation: Tallinn is the capital of Estonia. It is renowned for its walled, medieval Old Town, a UNESCO World Heritage site.

questions.text: What is the capital of Finland?
questions.explanation: Helsinki is the capital of Finland, located on the shore of the Baltic Sea. It's known for its modern architecture and its distinctive white cathedral.

questions.text: What is the capital of France?
questions.explanation: Paris, the capital of France, is known as the 'City of Light.' It is world-renowned for its landmarks like the Eiffel Tower and the Louvre Museum.

questions.text: What is the capital of Germany?
questions.explanation: Berlin is the capital of unified Germany. It is famous for its modern history, especially the remnants of the Berlin Wall and the iconic Brandenburg Gate.

questions.text: What is the capital of Greece?
questions.explanation: Athens is the capital of Greece and the cradle of Western civilization. It's famous for the historic Parthenon temple atop the Acropolis hill.

questions.text: What is the capital of Hungary?
questions.explanation: Budapest is the capital of Hungary, divided by the Danube River. It is famous for its thermal baths and the majestic Parliament Building.

questions.text: What is the capital of Iceland?
questions.explanation: Reykjavík is the capital of Iceland and is the world's northernmost capital. It's known for its stunning natural scenery and proximity to hot springs.

questions.text: What is the capital of Ireland?
questions.explanation: Dublin is the capital of the Republic of Ireland. It has a rich literary history, having been home to great writers like James Joyce.

questions.text: What is the capital of Italy?
questions.explanation: Rome is the capital of Italy and is known as the 'Eternal City.' It was the center of the Roman Empire and features ancient ruins like the Colosseum.

questions.text: What is the capital of Latvia?
questions.explanation: Riga is the capital of Latvia and the largest city in the Baltic states. Its historic center is known for having the world's largest collection of Art Nouveau buildings.

questions.text: What is the capital of Liechtenstein?
questions.explanation: Vaduz is the capital of the small principality of Liechtenstein. It is famous for Vaduz Castle, which sits on a hill overlooking the city.

questions.text: What is the capital of Lithuania?
questions.explanation: Vilnius is the capital of Lithuania and is known for its Old Town, one of the largest surviving medieval old towns in Europe.

questions.text: What is the capital of Luxembourg?
questions.explanation: Luxembourg City is the capital of the Grand Duchy of Luxembourg. It is famous for its ancient fortifications and picturesque neighborhoods on different levels.

questions.text: What is the capital of Malta?
questions.explanation: Valletta is the capital of Malta, a fortified city that is entirely a UNESCO World Heritage site and one of the most concentrated historic areas in the world.

questions.text: What is the capital of Moldova?
questions.explanation: Chișinău is the capital and largest city of Moldova. It is known for its numerous parks and lakes.

questions.text: What is the capital of Monaco?
questions.explanation: Monaco is a city-state, so its capital is Monaco itself. It is famous for its luxurious lifestyle, the Monte Carlo Casino, and the Formula 1 Grand Prix.

questions.text: What is the capital of Montenegro?
questions.explanation: Podgorica is the official capital of Montenegro, while Cetinje is considered the Old Royal Capital.

questions.text: What is the capital of the Netherlands?
questions.explanation: Amsterdam is the official capital of the Netherlands, famous for its extensive canal system and distinctive gabled houses.

questions.text: What is the capital of North Macedonia?
questions.explanation: Skopje is the capital of North Macedonia. It is known for the 'Skopje 2014' project, which added many neoclassical-style statues and buildings to the city.

questions.text: What is the capital of Norway?
questions.explanation: Oslo is the capital of Norway, surrounded by forests and green spaces. It is famous for its maritime museums displaying historic Viking ships.

questions.text: What is the capital of Poland?
questions.explanation: Warsaw is the capital of Poland. It was heavily destroyed during World War II and its Old Town was meticulously rebuilt.

questions.text: What is the capital of Portugal?
questions.explanation: Lisbon is the capital of Portugal, a coastal city built on seven hills, known for its historic yellow trams.

questions.text: What is the capital of Romania?
questions.explanation: Bucharest is the capital of Romania, nicknamed 'Little Paris' for its elegant architecture.

questions.text: What is the capital of Russia?
questions.explanation: Moscow is the capital of Russia and its political and economic heart. It is famous for the Kremlin and Red Square.

questions.text: What is the capital of San Marino?
questions.explanation: The City of San Marino is the capital of the Republic of San Marino, a small country completely surrounded by Italy.

questions.text: What is the capital of Serbia?
questions.explanation: Belgrade is the capital of Serbia, located at the confluence of the Danube and Sava rivers. It is known for the historic Belgrade Fortress.

questions.text: What is the capital of Slovakia?
questions.explanation: Bratislava is the capital of Slovakia and is the only capital in the world that borders two countries (Austria and Hungary).

questions.text: What is the capital of Slovenia?
questions.explanation: Ljubljana is the capital of Slovenia, known for its pedestrian-friendly center and the famous Dragon Bridge.

questions.text: What is the capital of Spain?
questions.explanation: Madrid is the capital of Spain, located in the heart of the country. It is famous as a center for the arts, housing the Prado Museum.

questions.text: What is the capital of Sweden?
questions.explanation: Stockholm, the capital of Sweden, is built on 14 islands connected by more than 50 bridges.

questions.text: What is the capital of Switzerland?
questions.explanation: Bern is the federal capital of Switzerland. It is famous for its medieval Old Town, which is a UNESCO World Heritage site.

questions.text: What is the capital of Ukraine?
questions.explanation: Kyiv is the capital of Ukraine and one of the oldest cities in Eastern Europe. It is known for the Kyiv Pechersk Lavra monastery and its golden domes.

questions.text: What is the capital of the United Kingdom?
questions.explanation: London is the capital of the United Kingdom and England. It is a leading global city and home to famous landmarks like Big Ben and Buckingham Palace.

questions.text: What is the capital of Vatican City?
questions.explanation: Vatican City is the smallest country in the world and a city-state, so its capital is Vatican City itself. It is located entirely within the city of Rome.

questions.text: What is the capital of Algeria?
questions.explanation: Algiers is the capital and largest city of Algeria. It is famous for its historic Casbah, a UNESCO World Heritage site.

questions.text: What is the capital of Angola?
questions.explanation: Luanda is the capital of Angola and one of the oldest colonial cities in Africa. It is a major port and important industrial center.

questions.text: What is the capital of Benin?
questions.explanation: Porto-Novo is the official capital of Benin, while the nearby city of Cotonou is the economic capital and seat of government.

questions.text: What is the capital of Botswana?
questions.explanation: Gaborone is the capital of Botswana, one of the fastest-growing cities in the world and the country's administrative and economic center.

questions.text: What is the capital of Burkina Faso?
questions.explanation: Ouagadougou is the capital of Burkina Faso and is famous for hosting the Panafrican Film and Television Festival (FESPACO).

questions.text: What is the capital of Burundi?
questions.explanation: Gitega became the political capital of Burundi in 2019, while Bujumbura remains the economic capital.

questions.text: What is the capital of Cabo Verde?
questions.explanation: Praia is the capital and largest city of Cabo Verde, located on the island of Santiago.

questions.text: What is the capital of Cameroon?
questions.explanation: Yaoundé is the political capital of Cameroon, notable for its location on a series of hills.

questions.text: What is the capital of the Central African Republic?
questions.explanation: Bangui is the capital of the Central African Republic, located on the banks of the Ubangi River.

questions.text: What is the capital of Chad?
questions.explanation: N'Djamena is the capital and largest city of Chad, and an important river port on the Chari River.

questions.text: What is the capital of Comoros?
questions.explanation: Moroni is the capital of Comoros, located on the west coast of Grande Comore island.

questions.text: What is the capital of the Democratic Republic of the Congo?
questions.explanation: Kinshasa is the capital of the Democratic Republic of the Congo and is considered the largest French-speaking city in the world.

questions.text: What is the capital of the Republic of the Congo?
questions.explanation: Brazzaville is the capital of the Republic of the Congo, located on the opposite bank of the Congo River from Kinshasa.

questions.text: What is the capital of Ivory Coast?
questions.explanation: Yamoussoukro is the political capital of Ivory Coast, while Abidjan remains the economic capital and largest city.

questions.text: What is the capital of Djibouti?
questions.explanation: Djibouti City is the capital of the Republic of Djibouti, possessing a strategic location on the Bab-el-Mandeb strait.

questions.text: What is the capital of Egypt?
questions.explanation: Cairo is the capital of Egypt and the largest city in the Arab world, famous for its ancient history.

questions.text: What is the capital of Equatorial Guinea?
questions.explanation: Malabo is the capital of Equatorial Guinea, located on the island of Bioko.

questions.text: What is the capital of Eritrea?
questions.explanation: Asmara is the capital of Eritrea, famous for its Italian modernist architecture.

questions.text: What is the capital of Eswatini?
questions.explanation: Mbabane is the administrative capital of Eswatini (formerly Swaziland), while Lobamba is the legislative and royal capital.

questions.text: What is the capital of Ethiopia?
questions.explanation: Addis Ababa is the capital of Ethiopia and is considered the 'political capital of Africa' for hosting the headquarters of the African Union.

questions.text: What is the capital of Gabon?
questions.explanation: Libreville is the capital and largest city of Gabon, a coastal city situated on the Komo River estuary.

questions.text: What is the capital of The Gambia?
questions.explanation: Banjul is the capital of The Gambia, located on an island at the mouth of the Gambia River.

questions.text: What is the capital of Ghana?
questions.explanation: Accra is the capital of Ghana and its administrative and economic center, known for its vibrant markets and beaches.

questions.text: What is the capital of Guinea?
questions.explanation: Conakry is the capital of Guinea, a coastal city and a major port on the Atlantic Ocean.

questions.text: What is the capital of Guinea-Bissau?
questions.explanation: Bissau is the capital and largest city of Guinea-Bissau, serving as the country's main port and administrative center.

questions.text: What is the capital of Kenya?
questions.explanation: Nairobi is the capital of Kenya and is famous for being the only city in the world with a national safari park.

questions.text: What is the capital of Lesotho?
questions.explanation: Maseru is the capital of Lesotho, a mountainous kingdom completely surrounded by South Africa.

questions.text: What is the capital of Liberia?
questions.explanation: Monrovia is the capital of Liberia and was named in honor of U.S. President James Monroe.

questions.text: What is the capital of Libya?
questions.explanation: Tripoli is the capital and largest city of Libya, known for its walled old city and the Red Castle (As-saraya al-hamra).

questions.text: What is the capital of Madagascar?
questions.explanation: Antananarivo, or 'Tana,' is the capital of Madagascar, located in the central highlands of the island.

questions.text: What is the capital of Malawi?
questions.explanation: Lilongwe is the capital of Malawi, known for its craft markets and the Lilongwe Wildlife Centre.

questions.text: What is the capital of Mali?
questions.explanation: Bamako is the capital of Mali, located on the banks of the Niger River, and is an important commercial and cultural hub in West Africa.

questions.text: What is the capital of Mauritania?
questions.explanation: Nouakchott is the capital of Mauritania, a coastal city that rapidly developed from a small village to become the country's center.

questions.text: What is the capital of Mauritius?
questions.explanation: Port Louis is the capital of Mauritius, an island in the Indian Ocean known for its diverse cultural mix.

questions.text: What is the capital of Morocco?
questions.explanation: Rabat is the political capital of Morocco, known for its historical landmarks like the Kasbah of the Udayas and the Hassan Tower.

questions.text: What is the capital of Mozambique?
questions.explanation: Maputo is the capital of Mozambique, a coastal city known for its Portuguese colonial architecture and wide avenues.

questions.text: What is the capital of Namibia?
questions.explanation: Windhoek is the capital of Namibia, characterized by its German architectural influences from the colonial era.

questions.text: What is the capital of Niger?
questions.explanation: Niamey is the capital of Niger, located on the banks of the Niger River, and serves as the country's administrative and economic center.

questions.text: What is the capital of Nigeria?
questions.explanation: Abuja has been the capital of Nigeria since 1991; it is a planned city built in the 1980s.

questions.text: What is the capital of Rwanda?
questions.explanation: Kigali is the capital of Rwanda, known for its cleanliness and order, and is considered one of the safest cities in Africa.

questions.text: What is the capital of Sao Tome and Principe?
questions.explanation: São Tomé is the capital of the state of São Tomé and Príncipe, a small island nation located in the Gulf of Guinea.

questions.text: What is the capital of Senegal?
questions.explanation: Dakar is the capital of Senegal, located at the westernmost point of Africa and famous for being the finishing point of the Dakar Rally.

questions.text: What is the capital of Seychelles?
questions.explanation: Victoria is the capital of Seychelles, one of the smallest capitals in the world, located on the island of Mahé.

questions.text: What is the capital of Sierra Leone?
questions.explanation: Freetown is the capital of Sierra Leone, a major port on the Atlantic Ocean known for its beautiful beaches.

questions.text: What is the capital of Somalia?
questions.explanation: Mogadishu is the capital of Somalia, a historic coastal city that was an important commercial center for centuries.

questions.text: What is the capital of South Africa?
questions.explanation: South Africa has three capitals: Pretoria (administrative), Cape Town (legislative), and Bloemfontein (judicial).

questions.text: What is the capital of South Sudan?
questions.explanation: Juba is the capital of the Republic of South Sudan, the world's newest country, located on the banks of the White Nile.

questions.text: What is the capital of Sudan?
questions.explanation: Khartoum is the capital of Sudan, located at the confluence of the two Niles, the White Nile and the Blue Nile.

questions.text: What is the capital of Tanzania?
questions.explanation: Dodoma is the official capital of Tanzania, although Dar es Salaam remains the country's main economic center.

questions.text: What is the capital of Togo?
questions.explanation: Lomé is the capital of Togo, a coastal city known for its large markets and palm-lined beaches.

questions.text: What is the capital of Tunisia?
questions.explanation: The city of Tunis is the capital of Tunisia, located near the site of the ancient Phoenician city of Carthage and known for its old medina.

questions.text: What is the capital of Uganda?
questions.explanation: Kampala is the capital and largest city of Uganda. It was said to have originally been built on seven hills.

questions.text: What is the capital of Zambia?
questions.explanation: Lusaka is the capital of Zambia and one of the fastest-growing cities in southern Africa.

questions.text: What is the capital of Zimbabwe?
questions.explanation: Harare is the capital of Zimbabwe, known for its wide avenues lined with jacaranda trees.

questions.text: What is the capital of the United States?
questions.explanation: Washington, D.C. is the political capital of the United States. It houses the headquarters of the federal government, such as the White House and the Capitol Building.

questions.text: What is the capital of Canada?
questions.explanation: Ottawa is the capital of Canada. It is famous for the Parliament Building and the Rideau Canal, which freezes in winter to become the world's longest skating rink.

questions.text: What is the capital of Mexico?
questions.explanation: Mexico City is the capital of Mexico and one of the largest cities in the world. It was built on the ruins of the ancient Aztec capital, Tenochtitlan.

questions.text: What is the capital of Cuba?
questions.explanation: Havana is the capital of Cuba. It is known for its UNESCO-listed Old Town, colorful classic cars, and vibrant music.

questions.text: What is the capital of Panama?
questions.explanation: Panama City is the capital of Panama, a modern cosmopolitan city located at the Pacific entrance of the Panama Canal.

questions.text: What is the capital of Jamaica?
questions.explanation: Kingston is the capital and largest city of Jamaica. It is famous for being the birthplace of reggae music and has a museum dedicated to music legend Bob Marley.

questions.text: What is the capital of Costa Rica?
questions.explanation: San José is the capital of Costa Rica, located in the country's Central Valley. It is known as one of the safest and most modern cities in Central America.

questions.text: What is the capital of Guatemala?
questions.explanation: Guatemala City is the capital of Guatemala and the most populous city in Central America.

questions.text: What is the capital of the Dominican Republic?
questions.explanation: Santo Domingo is the capital of the Dominican Republic. It is considered the oldest continuously inhabited European settlement in the Americas.

questions.text: What is the capital of El Salvador?
questions.explanation: San Salvador is the capital and the financial and political center of El Salvador. It is located in an earthquake-prone area and is known for its surrounding volcanoes.

questions.text: What is the capital of Honduras?
questions.explanation: Tegucigalpa is the capital of Honduras. It is located in a mountainous region and is characterized by its winding streets and high altitudes.

questions.text: What is the capital of Nicaragua?
questions.explanation: Managua is the capital of Nicaragua, located on the southern shore of Lake Managua. It suffered two devastating earthquakes in the 20th century.

questions.text: What is the capital of Brazil?
questions.explanation: Brasília is the federal capital of Brazil. It was planned and built in the 1950s to be the new capital and is known for its modern architecture.

questions.text: What is the capital of Argentina?
questions.explanation: Buenos Aires is the capital and largest city of Argentina. It is famous for being the birthplace of tango and has a European feel to its architecture.

questions.text: What is the capital of Colombia?
questions.explanation: Bogotá is the capital of Colombia, located at a high altitude of 2,640 meters above sea level, making it one of the highest capitals in the world.

questions.text: What is the capital of Peru?
questions.explanation: Lima is the capital of Peru. It was founded by Spanish conquistador Francisco Pizarro and is known for its historic center displaying colonial architecture.

questions.text: What is the capital of Chile?
questions.explanation: Santiago is the capital of Chile, located in a valley surrounded by the Andes mountains. It is the country's financial and cultural center.

questions.text: What is the capital of Venezuela?
questions.explanation: Caracas is the capital of Venezuela, located in a mountain valley near the Caribbean Sea.

questions.text: What is the capital of Ecuador?
questions.explanation: Quito, the capital of Ecuador, is famous for being located directly on the equator. Its historic center is one of the best-preserved in Latin America.

questions.text: What is the capital of Bolivia?
questions.explanation: La Paz is the seat of government of Bolivia and the highest administrative capital in the world. The official (constitutional) capital is Sucre.

questions.text: What is the capital of Paraguay?
questions.explanation: Asunción is the capital of Paraguay, located on the banks of the Paraguay River, and is one of the oldest cities founded by Europeans on the continent.

questions.text: What is the capital of Uruguay?
questions.explanation: Montevideo is the capital of Uruguay, located on the country's southern coast. It is known for its beaches and its old town with colonial buildings.

questions.text: What is the capital of Guyana?
questions.explanation: Georgetown is the capital of Guyana. It is known for its tree-lined streets and British colonial wooden buildings.

questions.text: What is the capital of Suriname?
questions.explanation: Paramaribo is the capital of Suriname. Its historic inner city features a unique fusion of Dutch architecture and local traditions and is a UNESCO World Heritage site.

questions.text: What is the capital of Australia?
questions.explanation: Canberra is the political capital of Australia. Unlike other major cities, it is an inland city specifically designed and planned to be the capital.

questions.text: What is the capital of New Zealand?
questions.explanation: Wellington is the capital of New Zealand. It is known as the southernmost capital in the world and is famous for its arts and culture scene.

questions.text: What is the capital of Fiji?
questions.explanation: Suva is the capital and largest city of Fiji. It is the country's political and economic center and a major port in the South Pacific.

questions.text: What is the capital of Papua New Guinea?
questions.explanation: Port Moresby is the capital of Papua New Guinea, located on the coast of the Gulf of Papua. It is the largest city in the South Pacific region.

questions.text: What is the capital of Samoa?
questions.explanation: Apia is the capital and the only city in Samoa. It is located on the north coast of Upolu island.

questions.text: What is the capital of the Solomon Islands?
questions.explanation: Honiara is the capital of the Solomon Islands, located on the northwestern coast of Guadalcanal island.

questions.text: What is the capital of Tonga?
questions.explanation: Nuku'alofa is the capital of the Kingdom of Tonga. It is located on the coast of the island of Tongatapu.

questions.text: What is the capital of Vanuatu?
questions.explanation: Port Vila is the capital and largest city of Vanuatu, and it is the economic and commercial center of the archipelago.
